Can the application only be deployed man: Are environments (DEV, TEST, PROD, etc.) provisioned manually?
Is there no regularly schedule releases for the team?
Are artifacts assembled, in whole or part, manually?
This section describes the list of DevOps practices all teams should adopt at a minimum
Does the team use source control management tools?

Manual deployment of artifacts: Any build can be recreated from version control
Can the application only be deployed man: Can any prior version be reproduced from source control?
Is a build tool used to completely assemble the artifacts?
Is the build tool run regularly?

Manual deployment of artifacts: Commits are tied to tasks (and backlog items)
Can the application only be deployed man: Are commits related to particular items in the backlog?
Is there a dedicated server to assemble the artifacts?
Is the manual deployment of the artifact well documented?
Is some of the deployment process scripted in any manner?
This section describes the practices where teams begin to manage their processes
Does the build server poll the source code management system for changes to trigger building new artifacts?
Are the artifacts of the build process stored for later analysis?
Are libraries required by the artifact, and the artifact itself, stored and managed?
Are the artifacts versioned using some well documented methodology?
Has the team started to standardize the deployment of the artifacts in any environment (DEV, TEST, PROD)?
Doe the tem conduct regular builds which include testing to ensure commits do not break existing functionality?
These practices are exhibited by teams who deliver consistent quality artifacts
Are builds triggered automatically when code changes are committed to the source code management system?
Are versions generated automatically by the build process?
Is there one build for all environments (DEV, TEST, PROD)?
Are all build artifacts checked into a central repository for use by other processes and teams?
Are required changes to application databases automated as part of the deployment process?
Are release noted generated automatically from the backlog?

Manual deployment of artifacts: Build fails if quality metrics are not met
Can the application only be deployed man: Can static analysis results cause the build to fail?

Manual deployment of artifacts: Basic pipeline with deployment to Prod
Can the application only be deployed man: Does the team build, test and deploy to all environment including production when code is checked in?

Manual deployment of artifacts: No broken builds (board is all green)
Can the application only be deployed man: Does the team allow build processes to remain in a failure state?
Does the team automatically configure infrastructure to perform testing and deployment?
Does the team use automated methods to determine the deployment environment and adjust configurations accordingly?
These practices are exhibited by teams well-practiced in continual delivery
Can the application be deployed without bringing down the application?
Can the deployment be coordinated with other teams and artifacts?

Manual deployment of artifacts: Push button deployment of any artifact to any environment
Can the application only be deployed man: Can the team deploy any version of any artifact to any environment in an automated manner?
Can the development team deploy new versions in parallel with prior versions and control access to each version?

Manual deployment of artifacts: Team prioritizes deployable code over new work
Can the application only be deployed man: Does the team make sure the code deploys smoothly before new features are added?
Does the team use multiple build servers (master and nodes) in their deployment process?
Are required changes to the database automated, or are there any manual steps?

Manual deployment of artifacts: Now you are just showing off
Can the application only be deployed man: These practices are on the bleeeding edge of DevOps practices
Does the team utilize containers to deploy completely configured services or versions of their application?
Can the application be deployed without any manual intervention?
Can the application be deployed on an unknown number of platforms?
